title: Ethereum price action and derivatives data confirm bears are currently in control - Cointelegraph
summary: Ethereum price has been range-bound between $1,560 and $1,600, with bears in control due to a lack of volatility and increased recession risks. Derivatives data shows reduced demand for long positions, indicating a potential resistance level at $1,560. The 25% delta skew indicator has risen above 10%, indicating professional traders are overcharging for upside protection. This suggests a bearish outlook for Ethereum in the near term.

title: Ancient Ethereum Whale Comes to Life, Transfers 10,266 ETH – Here’s Where the Crypto Is Going - The Daily Hodl
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

An ancient Ethereum whale that was dormant for over five years has come to life, transferring 10,266 ETH worth $16 million. The wallet obtained the ETH through mining in 2017 and split it into several unknown addresses. 1,322 ETH worth $2 million was sent to the crypto exchange Poloniex. The whale now holds only 1.25 ETH worth $2,000. Other notable movements include a crypto whale purchasing 28,762 GMX and 59,064 GNS from Binance, indicative of bullishness on decentralized derivative exchanges.

title: EIP 4337 Activated by Ethereum (ETH): Comprehensive Guide - U.Today
summary: Ethereum's EIP 4337 has gone live, enabling the Account Abstraction mechanism, which increases the functionality of non-custodial Ethereum wallets and makes them more secure. This upgrade allows users to turn their wallets into smart contracts and supercharge them with extra functionality. With EIP 4337, users can easily turn their accounts into multi-signature storage, eliminating the need for private keys. This update is significant for the security, operability, and mass adoption of the Ethereum network, and it will enable 100% "gas-less" contracts and make the user experience more newbie-friendly.

title: Airdrop Farmers Eye Ethereum Layer 2s For Potential Tokens - The Defiant - DeFi News
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Airdrop farmers are eyeing Ethereum Layer 2s, such as Arbitrum, for potential token airdrops. The price of a Polymarket contract predicting an Arbitrum airdrop surged 150% earlier today. Scroll, a Layer 2 rollup powered by zero-knowledge proofs, launched its testnet on Goerli and raised $50M in funding. The team has seen 180,000 unique wallets execute 665,000 transactions on its testnet. Several teams, including Scroll, are working on delivering the first zero-knowledge powered rollup compatible with Ethereum's core smart contract engine.

title: Raoul Pal says Ethereum is the fastest growing economy globally - crypto.news
summary: Raoul Pal, CEO of Real Vision, has created a new framework for understanding the cryptocurrency ecosystem, comparing Bitcoin and Ethereum to economies rather than assets. He believes Ethereum is the fastest-growing economy globally, with opportunities for capital gains through private sector lending, NFTs, and dApps. XRP is compared to the U.K., lacking innovation, and Solana is compared to South Korea after the Asian crisis. Pal advises investing time to find the best options, diversifying, and dollar cost averaging to minimize potential losses. Ethereum is seen as the easiest way to invest with the least risk.

title: Ethereum Founder Gives UCSD $15 Million for Open-Source Research into Airborne Pathogens - Times of San Diego
summary: Vitalik Buterin, founder of Ethereum, donated $15 million to UC San Diego for open-source research into airborne pathogens and pollution. The Meta-Institute for Airborne Disease in a Changing Climate will be established, using expertise from various fields to better understand aerosolized pathogens and their impact on health. The gift is one of the largest cryptocurrency donations to a US university and will support interdisciplinary research published in open-access journals.

title: Polygon (MATIC) and Ethereum (ETH) are Listed for Leverage Trading on Covo Finance - PR Newswire
summary: Covo Finance, a decentralized trading platform, has listed Polygon (MATIC) and Ethereum (ETH) for leveraged trading, allowing users to trade these popular cryptocurrencies with up to 50x leverage. This expansion gives traders more opportunities to profit from the growing cryptocurrency market. To trade with leverage, users must connect their cryptocurrency wallet and deposit funds, then select the asset they want to trade and choose their desired leverage level. COVOLP, a token representing a share of the liquidity pool, can be staked to earn rewards and trading fees. The platform includes real-time market data, charting tools, and technical indicators to help traders make informed decisions. Trading fees are 0.1% of the position size, and there are no price impacts or slippage. Covo Finance is decentralized and peer-to-peer, reducing the risk of hacking or theft. However, leveraged trading carries risks, and traders should use caution when executing trades.

title: Macro Guru Raoul Pal Picks ‘Perfect Setup’ for Crypto Markets, Updates Ethereum, XRP and Solana Outlook - The Daily Hodl
summary: Macro Guru Raoul Pal has shared his insights on the current state of the crypto market, comparing various projects to national economies. He believes that investors should view crypto projects as digital nation-states, rather than just assets or tech advancements. Pal argues that the Bitcoin network is like the Catholic Church in the Dark Ages, with a strict supply of Bitcoin that cannot be altered. In contrast, the Ethereum network shares more similarities with the complex US economy, with a deflationary supply of ETH and a decentralized financial system. He also compares XRP and Solana to their respective national economies, with XRP resembling the UK and Solana similar to South Korea after the Asian crisis. Pal concludes that the total market capitalization of crypto assets is flashing a "perfect setup" between two long-term support levels.

title: Analyst Known for Calling Crypto Bottoms Issues Ethereum and BNB Warning, Says Easy Mode Over for Now - The Daily Hodl
summary: Analyst Smart Contracter warns Ethereum (ETH) and Binance (BNB) holders of potential bearish signals. The analyst notes that the US is targeting Binance and this may be reflected in the chart.

title: Amazon to launch NFT marketplace next month, what can we expect? - Yahoo Finance UK
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Amazon is launching an NFT marketplace next month, allowing customers to purchase digital collectibles with their Amazon accounts. The marketplace will have 15 NFT collections available at launch, with the option to purchase NFTs linked to physical goods delivered to customers' doorsteps. This is a significant development in the NFT space, as it makes it easier for people without a crypto wallet to buy NFTs. The marketplace could be called either 'Amazon NFT Marketplace' or 'Amazon Digital Marketplace.' The launch has been in development for months, and Amazon has been taking progressive steps towards incorporating more Web3 features into its platforms. Despite the NFT market slump and the FTX collapse, the interest in NFTs among consumers has been slowly picking up pace again, with companies like Gucci, Nike, and McDonald's developing digital collectibles as a promotional strategy.

title: Ethereum Founder Buterin Dumps These Meme Coins, What You Need to Know - NewsBTC
summary: Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin has sold a significant portion of his meme coins, including 50 billion MOPS, 10 billion CULT, and 500 trillion SHIK, worth millions of dollars. The sales have had a significant impact on the prices of these low-value cryptocurrencies. Buterin has not sold all of his CULT tokens and has transferred some of the proceeds to the Ethereum Foundation. The crypto community is divided on Buterin's motivations for selling the altcoins, with some speculating that he may be trying to cover tax costs or that he has a history of donating the funds. Buterin has also revealed his favorite DEX, CoW Swap, which has a market capitalization of only 7 million.

title: Tornado Cash dev says 'sequel' to crypto mixer aims to be regulator-friendly - Cointelegraph
summary: A former Tornado Cash developer is building a new crypto mixing service called Privacy Pools, which aims to solve the "critical flaw" of Tornado Cash by allowing users to opt out of an anonymity set containing stolen or laundered funds. The new service uses zero-knowledge proofs to preserve user privacy while helping regulators isolate illicit funds. The developer hopes this solution will empower the community to defend against hackers without requiring blanket regulation or sacrificing crypto ideals. Privacy Pools is already live on Optimism, but the code is still experimental and has not been audited. The developer is calling for on-chain forensics platforms to conduct tracebacks on deposits to create subset exclusion lists. This attempt to create a crypto-friendly on-chain privacy solution comes after the US Office of Foreign Asset Control sanctioned ETH and USDC addresses linked to Tornado Cash in response to alleged thefts by North Korea's Lazarus Group.

title: Tezos and its Top 2 Bridges - Altcoin Buzz
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Tezos has two bridges for bridging assets between different blockchains: Allbridge and Plenty Bridge. Allbridge connects 18 chains, including EVM and non-EVM chains, while Plenty Bridge connects Ethereum, Polygon, and Ethereum-based tokens to Tezos. Both bridges are available now, with Allbridge being the more established option and Plenty Bridge still in beta. Using the bridges saves users from having to go through a centralized exchange (CEX) and can result in cost savings and faster transactions. Tezos has a different way of upgrading its blockchain through software updates that allow holders of the XTZ token to vote on changes, avoiding a fork. The current XTZ price is $1.13 with a $1 billion market cap and an infinite total supply of 921.7 million XTZ tokens in circulation.

title: Like a Blur: Tensor Plans Massive Airdrop for Solana NFT Traders - Yahoo Finance
summary: Tensor, a Solana NFT marketplace, is offering a massive airdrop for traders who have bought or sold Solana NFTs on any marketplace over the past six months. The airdrop is similar to Blur's model, which rocketed to the top of Ethereum NFT trading volume in February. Tensor has seen a surge in trading volume and has raised a $3 million seed round led by Placeholder. The platform is offering reward "boxes" to traders based on their activity on the platform, with the promise of "fun things you might like" and a potential token launch in the future. The second season airdrop will only reward trading activity on Tensor's platform, with a loyalty metric and points leaderboard to gamify the trading process.

title: Top 2 Bridges for Cardano (ADA) - DeFi - Altcoin Buzz

Top 2 Bridges for Cardano (ADA) - DeFi - Altcoin Buzz

* Bridging ADA is easy, using a platform that supports Cardano and other blockchains
* Cardano is one of the world's leading blockchains for enterprise-grade applications, making bridging ADA beneficial for scalability, security, and governance features
* Microchain and Milkomeda are two bridges for ADA, providing cross-chain services and enabling multi-chain and multi-layer functionality

* Milkomeda connects Cardano with Ethereum, giving users access to Ethereum's features and existing smart contracts and DeFi services
* ADA can be bought on cryptocurrency exchanges like Coinbase or Binance and stored in hot or cold wallets for safekeeping.

title: Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin donates $15m to UC San Diego for airborne pathogen research - Cryptopolitan
summary: Vitalik Buterin, co-founder of Ethereum, donated $15 million to UC San Diego for airborne pathogen research through his Balvi Filantropic Fund. This is the largest donation ever made to an American university and the biggest donation towards open-source research on aerosols. The fund will support atmospheric chemist Kimberly Prather's research into airborne microbes in a changing climate, with the goal of improving indoor air quality and protecting people from airborne diseases. The Balvi fund has also donated over $15 million to coronavirus-related research projects, including a tool to detect virus outbreaks quickly and research into a long-term condition caused by COVID-19. The crypto community has been a major contributor to global causes, including donations to victims of Russia's attacks in Ukraine and aid for those affected by earthquakes in Turkey and Syria.
